member.name: T:Easy.Logger.AsyncBufferingForwardingAppender
member.summary: An appender which batches the log events and asynchronously forwards them to any configured appenders.

member.name: P:Easy.Logger.AsyncBufferingForwardingAppender.IdleTime
member.summary:
Gets or sets the idle-time in milliseconds at which any pending logging events are flushed. The idle-time in milliseconds.
The value should be a positive integer representing the maximum idle-time of logging events to be collected in the . When this value is reached, buffered events are then flushed. By default the idle-time is 500 milliseconds.
If the is set to a value less than or equal to 0 then use the default value is used.

member.name: M:Easy.Logger.AsyncBufferingForwardingAppender.#ctor
member.summary: Creates an instance of the

member.name: M:Easy.Logger.AsyncBufferingForwardingAppender.ActivateOptions
member.summary: Activates the options for this appender.

member.name: M:Easy.Logger.AsyncBufferingForwardingAppender.SendBuffer(log4net.Core.LoggingEvent[])
member.summary: Forwards the events to every configured appender.
member.param: The events that need to be forwarded

member.name: M:Easy.Logger.AsyncBufferingForwardingAppender.OnClose
member.summary: Ensures that all pending logging events are flushed out before exiting.

member.name: M:Easy.Logger.AsyncBufferingForwardingAppender.InvokeFlushIfIdle
member.summary: This only flushes if is False.

member.name: M:Easy.Logger.Log4NetLogger.Trace(System.Object)
member.summary: Logs a message object with the level.
member.param: The message object to be logged.

remarks.para: This method first checks if this logger is Debug enabled by comparing the level of this logger with the level. If this logger is Debug enabled, then it converts the message object (passed as parameter) to a string by invoking the appropriate . It then proceeds to call all the registered appenders in this logger and also higher in the hierarchy depending on the value of the additivity flag.
WARNING Note that passing an to this method will print the name of the but no stack trace. To print a stack trace use the form instead.

member.name: M:Easy.Logger.Log4NetService.#ctor
member.summary: Creates and configures an instance of the by looking for a default log4net.config file in the executing directory. It gets the directory path of the calling application RelativeSearchPath IS NULL if the executing assembly i.e. calling assembly is a stand-alone assembly file (Console, WinForm, etc). RelativeSearchPath IS NOT NULL if the calling assembly is a web hosted application i.e. a WebSite
member.exception: Thrown when a valid log4net.config file is not found

member.exception: Thrown when log4net Config file is null
Thrown when a valid log4net.config file is not found
member.remarks: If this method is not used, the will be configured by looking for a default log4net.config file in the executing directory.

member.summary: Creates an instance of

member.summary: Creates an instance of
member.param: The action to be executed when consuming the item.
The bounded size of the queue. Any more items added will block until there is more space available.

member.name: P:Easy.Logger.Sequencer`1.Capacity
member.summary: Returns the bounded capacity of the underlying queue. -1 for unbounded.

member.name: P:Easy.Logger.Sequencer`1.PendingCount
member.summary: Returns the count of items that are pending consumption.

member.name: P:Easy.Logger.Sequencer`1.PendingItems
member.summary: Returns the pending items in the queue. Note, the items are valid as the snapshot at the time of invocation.

member.name: P:Easy.Logger.Sequencer`1.ShutdownRequested
member.summary: Gets whether has started to shutdown.

member.name: E:Easy.Logger.Sequencer`1.OnException
member.summary: Thrown when the throws an exception.

member.name: M:Easy.Logger.Sequencer`1.Enqueue(`0)
member.summary: Adds the specified item to the . This method blocks if the queue is full and until there is more room.
member.param: The item to be added.

member.name: M:Easy.Logger.Sequencer`1.TryEnqueue(`0)
member.summary: Attempts to add the specified item to the .
member.param: The item to be added.
member.returns: True if item could be added; otherwise False. If the item is a duplicate, and the underlying collection does not accept duplicate items, then an InvalidOperationException is thrown.

member.name: M:Easy.Logger.Sequencer`1.TryEnqueue(`0,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Attempts to add the specified item to the .
member.param: The item to be added.
A TimeSpan that represents the number of milliseconds to wait, or a TimeSpan that represents -1 milliseconds to wait indefinitely.
member.returns: True if the item could be added to the collection within the specified time span; otherwise, False.

member.name: M:Easy.Logger.Sequencer`1.Shutdown(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Marks the instance as not accepting any more items. Any outstanding items will be consumed.
member.param: Flag indicating whether to wait for pending items to be processed.
